means: （袜子等的）后跟( heel的名词复数 )

sentence.Network_en: Unfortunately, bad news has come hard on the heels of good.
sentence.Network_cn: 很遗憾，好消息的后面紧跟着就是坏消息。

sentence.Network_en: He stood a few moments, rocking back and forwards on his heels.
sentence.Network_cn: 他站了一会儿，踮着脚跟前后摇晃。

sentence.Network_en: They were bunching up, almost treading upon each other's heels.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们几乎脚尖踩着脚跟地挤作一团。

坡跟鞋（wedge heel），坡跟鞋属于高跟鞋，但坡跟鞋前面脚掌下也有一定的高度，如果同等的高度的普通高跟鞋和坡跟鞋相比较， …

entry.def: Your heel is the back part of your foot, just below your ankle.
The heel of a shoe is the raised part on the bottom at the back.

example.ex: He kicked it shut with the heel of his boot.
example.tran: 他用靴子的后跟将它踢上。

entry.def: Heels are women's shoes that are raised very high at the back.

example.tran: 两位穿着高跟鞋、打扮入时的女士

example.ex: ...the old adage that you shouldn't wear heels with trousers.
example.tran: 高跟鞋不能和裤子搭配的俗话

entry.def: The heel of a sock or stocking is the part that covers your heel.
The heel of your hand is the rounded pad at the bottom of your palm.

example.ex: He shoved the heel of his hand against the side of my face.
example.tran: 他用手掌根使劲推我的脸颊。

entry.def: If a person or an animal is at your heels, they are following close behind you.

example.ex: She strode off down the restaurant with Cavendish following close at her heels.
example.tran: 她大步向餐馆里面走去，卡文迪什紧随其后。

entry.def: If you bring someone to heel, you force them to obey you.

example.ex: It's still not clear how the president will use his power to bring the republics to heel.
example.tran: 总统将如何行使自己的权力使共和党人就范仍不太清楚。

entry.tran: 咔嚓一声立正（敬礼或问候）
entry.def: If someone such as a soldier clicks their heels, they make a sound by knocking the heels of their shoes together when saluting or greeting someone.

example.ex: ...a courtly European who still clicked his heels when he met a lady.
example.tran: 遇见女士仍咔嚓一声行礼的彬彬有礼的欧洲人

entry.def: If you are cooling your heels, someone is deliberately keeping you waiting, so that you get bored or impatient.

example.ex: Cohen didn't mention that he had Ted Forstmann cooling his heels in a back room.
example.tran: 科恩没有提起自己让泰德·福斯特曼在后室里空等的事。

entry.def: If you dig your heels in or dig in your heels, you refuse to do something such as change your opinions or plans, especially when someone is trying very hard to make you do so.

example.ex: It was really the British who, by digging their heels in, prevented any last-minute deal.
example.tran: 实际上是因为英国人拒不让步，才使得最后一刻达成协议的希望落空了。

entry.def: If you say that one event follows hard on the heels of another or hot on the heels of another, you mean that one happens very quickly or immediately after another.

example.ex: Unfortunately, bad news has come hard on the heels of good...
example.tran: 很遗憾，好消息的后面紧跟着就是坏消息。

example.ex: The visit follows hot on the heels of their season at the Edinburgh International Festival.
example.tran: 他们在爱丁堡国际艺术节上的表演季一结束，紧接着又要出访。

entry.def: If you say that someone is hot on your heels, you are emphasizing that they are chasing you and are not very far behind you.

example.ex: They sped through the American southwest with the law hot on their heels.
example.tran: 他们飞车穿越美国西南部，警察紧追其后。

entry.tran: 无聊地等;不耐烦地等待
entry.def: If you are kicking your heels, you are having to wait around with nothing to do, so that you get bored or impatient.

example.ex: The authorities wouldn't grant us permission to fly all the way down to San Francisco, so I had to kick my heels at Tunis Airport.
example.tran: 当局不允许我们直飞旧金山，所以我只好在突尼斯机场不耐烦地等待。

entry.tran: （尤指因生气或吃惊而）突然转身
entry.def: If you turn on your heel or spin on your heel, you suddenly turn round, especially because you are angry or surprised.

example.ex: He simply turned on his heel and walked away.

entry.def: If you take to your heels, you run away.

example.ex: He stood, for a moment, staring defiantly back at her, then took to his heels.
example.tran: 他站着不服地回瞪了她一会儿，然后就逃走了。

auth_sentence.content: He told diplomats he has big heels to fill.
auth_sentence.res_content: He told diplomats he has big heels to fill.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: He told diplomats he has big heels to fill.

auth_sentence.content: A slim...figure tittupping around the flat on stiletto heels.
auth_sentence.res_content: A slim...figure tittupping around the flat on stiletto heels.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: A slim...figure tittupping around the flat on stiletto heels.

auth_sentence.content: Jimmy Choo is considered a shoe-in for her heels.
auth_sentence.res_content: Jimmy Choo is considered a shoe-in for her heels.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Jimmy Choo is considered a shoe-in for her heels.

sentences.en: Her heels gave her the height she otherwise lacked.
sentences.cn: 高跟鞋弥补了她身高的不足。

sentences.en: She teetered along in her heels.
sentences.cn: 她穿着一双高跟鞋摇摇晃晃地走着。

sentences.en: Every day she walks past my house, with her little black dog at her heels.
sentences.cn: 她每天从我家门前经过，她的小黑狗紧跟着她。

sentences.en: Jane has the most points at the moment, but the other competitors are hot on her heels.
sentences.cn: 现在简得分最高，但是其他选手紧随其后。

sentences.en: The police are hard on his heels.
The burglars took to their heels when they heard the police arrive.
sentences.cn: 窃贼听见警察来了，拔腿就跑。
